summary: The Public Safety and Mental Health Reporting Act directs the Attorney General to collect annual data on interactions between law enforcement officers and individuals with mental illness. The collected data is for research and statistical purposes only and must not reveal individual identities. The Attorney General is mandated to create guidelines for data collection, consult with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, and submit an annual public summary to Congress. Funds are authorized for this effort from fiscal year 2026 to 2036. The bill references the definition of 'mental illness' from existing legislation.
